mechanoreception.notes: As demosponges, Hymedesmiidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and physical stimuli. This is inferred from the general sensory biology of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely present for detecting chemical cues in the water, aiding in feeding and other physiological processes. This is inferred from the general sensory biology of sponges.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors is unknown in Hymedesmiidae. Further research is needed.
